item.title: it can be hard to remember that the digital revolution is still in its early days

it can be hard to remember that the digital revolution is still in its early days

Raising your Digital Quotient from the McKinsey Quarterly. Read more here: http://www.mckinsey.com/business-functions/strategy-and-corporate-finance/our-insights/raising-your-digital-quotient

item.title: Blue Ocean Brain
item.description:
Blue Ocean Brain

Nonstop work can lead to "cerebral congestion," according to Scientific American. Taking regular breaks from work during the workday, in the evenings and weekends through reading for pleasure, exercising, taking naps, or other fun pastimes can help clear out all the information that we are required to process each day to do our jobs.

item.title: Why Your Brain Needs More Downtime
item.description:
Why Your Brain Needs More Downtime

Research on naps, meditation, nature walks and the habits of exceptional artists and athletes reveals how mental breaks increase productivity, replenish attention, solidify memories and encourage creativity Every now and then during the workweek-usually around three in the afternoon-a familiar ache begins to saturate my forehead and pool in my temples.

item.title: The 3 Most Harmful Addictions (Hint: 2 probably apply to you) - Part 1
item.description:
The 3 Most Harmful Addictions (Hint: 2 probably apply to you) - Part 1

You are addicted and probably don't even realize it. I didn't until I started feeling the incredible clarity as well as the withdrawal symptoms of getting off the most subtle of the 3. "The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and amonthly salary." ― Nassim Nicholas Taleb. 1.

item.title: Cruel Jokes - Rules and Lessons for April 1st
item.description:
Cruel Jokes - Rules and Lessons for April 1st

I'll never forget the April 1st where it seemed a very cruel joke been played on me. Lots of hard work had led to a huge breakthrough on a new program we were launching, but through various circumstances the storm clouds began looming over our parade.

item.title: The Value of Time
item.description:
The Value of Time

Lately I've been thinking a lot about the value of time. One of the psalmists of ancient Israel prays that God would "teach us to number our days". Regardless of your world-view, the practice of numbering your days - for me today is 16,256 - can be a very powerful and humbling thing.
